answers.answer: Did the Dr.not tell you ANYTHING about what was going on? Did he not tell you what meds he was giving her? Was anyone there with you, your Mom or Dad? If they were there ask them what he told them about her condition. He might have mentioned something to them when you weren't in the room.How old is your Granny? Does she have anything wrong with her that she is taking meds for, Diabetes, Heart, Dimentia, etc?Please check with her Dr. If you are her caretaker you need to know what is going on so you can help her.Please let us know what you find out as we here are concerned and are here to offer you ANY support that we can.Good luck....Sherry

It sounds like you need a new physician.It is common for physicians not to give proper attention to the elderly, and from what you describe this was not up to "the standard of care."By the same token you have an obligation, if your family member is incapable, of not leaving without knowing the names and doses of every medication and the provisional diagnosis.

question: My granny was rushed to the doctor Monday morning, feeling weak and tired. She was sweating, early hours of the morning. When we took her there, she couldn't walk, lift her head up, that's how weak she was. The doctor saw her, gave medication and told us not to worry too much about it. He advice her to sleep a lot and drink a lot of water.  Tuesday evening, we rushed her to the hospital, weak as well, but this time she was having memory loses and she blacked-out. she couldn't remember us, as her grand-children. The doctor gave her more medications (different ones this time) and anti-depress-end injection. We got home, she slept through the night, and this morning there were no improvement.What could be the reason behind this, please somebody help!
title: What could be wrong?
